utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Ten-second triviaVenezuela, Canada, Peru or Zimbabwe? Located in the South American country of Venezuela, the 3,200-foot Angel Falls is the tallest fall of them all. Now, some people don`t go chasing waterfalls. They stick to the rivers and lakes that they`re used to. But in Venezuela, some things just aren`t what they used to be like news anchors. Venezuelans are seeing increased fake news and widespread misinformation about their country through avatars, fake anchors made of artificial intelligence reporting the news. Though the avatars may have been created as a faster way to communicate information these fake videos are now being used to hide real problems going on inside Venezuela and many see it as propaganda. Stefano Pozzebon is on the story. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: STEFANO POZZEBON, CNN CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: This isn`t actually a real person. Take a closer look. This fake avatar was created using artificial intelligenceto look like a real human. In recent months, videos like these have been shared across Venezuelan social media and even on state-run television to spread misinformation about the country.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Media from different countries had described the event organized by Venezuela as a total and unexpected success.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: This year, Venezuelans have been taken to the street to demand better living conditions. The country`s minimum wage is less than tendollars a month. And last year, inflation was over 200 percent. But this artificial news clips have been trying to make the country look more prosperous. Marivi Marvin Vasquez (ph), the executive director at ProBox, a Venezuelan- based organization that monitors for online misinformation, says that these A.I.-generated people have been created and spread with a specific purpose.

utterances.speaker: MARIVI MARVIN, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, PROBOX
utterances.sentences: To sell to the international community a different reality about the country, of success, happiness andstability that really doesn`t exist.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: So how true is it that Venezuela is such a poor country? Has the media exaggerated things in that place?

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: And it`s not just social media. The Venezuelan government itself is helping to spread these videos on social media and even on state-runtelevision. Even Nicolas Maduro, the country`s embattled president, has shared the videos. NICOLAS MADURO, VENEZUELAN PRESIDENT (translated):  They are all artificial intelligence. They do not exist. They are robots created by artificial intelligence. I am robot.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: These fake videos are often in English with Spanish subtitles and are shared on social media which is often a trusty source of news formany Venezuelans, because the government imposes strict controls on the country`s traditional media.

utterances.speaker: CRISTINA TARDAGUILA, SENIOR PROGRAM DIRECTOR, INTERNATIONAL CENTER FOR JOURNALISTS
utterances.sentences: You go from completely lack of reliable information in thetraditional media, in your region, and then you go towards the other end. So, you`re suddenly like eating, drinking, smelling everything that is on your WhatsApp or your telegram or your social media.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Start by selecting an A.I. avatar.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Like me.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Or me.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Or me.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: These A.I. avatars are advertised as a way for companies to create easy to make instructional videos for example. The company behindthe technology says that it`s not intended to spread false narratives. When asked for comment, the company told CNN that it has since banned House of News from using it`s A.I. software. YouTube has also removed the channel from its platform. It`s still unclear who originally created these videos, as well as if the Venezuelan government was involved. The government did not respond to CNN`s request for comment.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Hey there. I`m Matt and I can --

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: If you`re unsure about whether or not a video that you`re watching is done by one of these fake avatars, pay close attention to theirspeech and mouth movement.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Has a dozen pavilions that occupy 23 hectares.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: Do their words align with the movements of their mouth. Do this movement feel awkward or constricted.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: Security will be in charge of guards from the general directory.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: If that is the case, you`re watching a digital avatar. It`s not a real person.

utterances.speaker: FAKE AVATAR
utterances.sentences: In Venezuela, it is estimated that 8 million people will mobilize in the next vacation.

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: When your friend and your own government are sharing this misinformation, it demands a lot more vigilance to see through the lies andfind the truth. (END VIDEOTAPE)
